title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces.

title: Venezuela’s Maduro sworn in as US raises reward for his capture
byline: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, whose nearly 12 years in office have been marked by deep economic and social crisis, was sworn in for a third term on Friday, despite a six-month-long election dispute, international calls for him to stand aside, and an increase in the U.S. reward offered for his capture.

title: 13 injured as bus veers off road in Passara
byline: A private passenger bus traveling from Colombo to Passara has reportedly veered off the road at the 10th mile post area in Passara earlier today, leaving 13 passengers injured.

title: Risk of breach in Diwulwewa tank bund resurfaces
byline: The water leak in the Diwulwewa tank in Galenbindunuwewa, which has posed a continuous risk of a breach of the bund, has resurfaced, raising concerns among local authorities and residents.

title: Three arrested in fake driving license racket in Polonnaruwa
byline: Officers of the Polonnaruwa Divisional Crime Investigation Division have apprehended a suspect involved in a racket of producing and distributing counterfeit driving licenses and vehicle registration documents.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism income soars over 53% in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka earned approximately 3.17 billion U.S. dollars from tourism in 2024, latest statistics from the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) shows.

title: Indian HC in Sri Lanka launches first Hindi Certificate Course via open, distance learning
byline: The Indian High Commission in Colombo on the occasion of “Hindi Diwas” (Hindi Day) on Friday launched Sri Lanka’s first Hindi Certificate Course through open and distance learning.

title: Rice import deadline expires; 167,000 MT cleared by Customs
byline: The deadline for the period during which permission was granted for the import of rice by the private sector expired at midnight yesterday (10).

title: IndiGo becomes largest foreign carrier out of Sri Lanka
byline: IndiGo has emerged as the largest foreign carrier operating out of Sri Lanka. The low-cost airline now operates 54 weekly flights between India and Sri Lanka, further cementing its position as a key player in the regional travel sector.

title: Revised alcohol and beer prices following excise duty hike
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, revised the excise duties on alcohol and cigarettes effective today (11).

title: Opposition to boycott COPE and other parliamentary committees
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Ajith P. Perera says that the opposition has collectively decided to boycott the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) and other parliamentary committees.

title: Pluto may have captured its largest moon with a ‘kiss,’ scientists say
byline: For decades, astronomers have tried to determine how Pluto acquired its unusually large moon Charon, which is about half the size of the dwarf planet. Now, new research suggests that Pluto and Charon briefly came together billions of years ago in a newly discovered “kiss and capture” collision.

title: Sri Lanka Test captain Dhananjaya de Silva’s brother arrested
byline: Savithra de Silva, also known as “Sangu,” the brother of Sri Lanka’s Test cricket captain Dhananjaya de Silva, has been arrested by Mount Lavinia Police following a violent altercation in Ratmalana.

title: No further rice imports: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Trade, Commerce, and Food Security, R.M. Jayawardena, stated that no further action will be taken to extend the circular permitting rice imports, which expired on January 10.

title: Sri Lankan President’s first visit to China is of great importance to bilateral ties: FM
byline: At the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will pay a state visit to China from January 14 to 17, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying announced on Friday.

title: Cigarette prices increased
byline: The prices of cigarettes have been increased from tomorrow (January 11) in line with the increase in the Excise Duty imposed on cigarettes, according to the Ceylon Tobacco Company (CTC).

title: Liquor prices increase with excise duty hike
byline: The prices of liquor will also increase by approximately 6% following the hike in Excise Duty imposed on liquor with effect from tomorrow (January 11).
